_header: Ye folks all which have devocion
Subjects: religious observance; envoys; mass, virtues of
_description: John Lydgate, ‘Virtues of the Mass’ — 83 8-line stanzas (ababbcbc), including envoy

BodHat73.First Lines:
Ye folkys alle that haue deuocion To here masse first doth your
                    besy cure
BodHat73.Last Lines:
Graunte or y dye crist for thi passion Y may resteyve this breed
                    sent doun from heuen

BodLauMis683.First Lines:
Yhe folkes alle whiche han deuociouneTo here
                    messe…
BodLauMis683.Note:
Lines 321-60 only: ‘A praier to the hooly
                    Sacrament’.
BodLauMis683.Attributed Title: HEre is a praier of the hooly sacrament (f. 30v)

OxfBal354.First Lines:
O ye folkes all which haue devocounTo here masse first doth your
                    besy cureWith all your inward contemplacounAs in a merour presentyng
                    in figure…
OxfBal354.Last Lines:
…Thyn auctor symple thorowgh affeccounHe may well pray them
                    þat shall the redeWith goodly support d to do
                    correccounThe to refowrm wher as they se nede
OxfBal354.Attributed Title: Prologus of the masse (p. 317); Explicit prologus (p. 317)
OxfBal354.Facsimiles:
Early Manuscripts at Oxford University: Facsimile
                    of Oxford, Balliol MS 354.
         (http://image.ox.ac.uk/show?collection=balliol&manuscript=ms354).

CamGon174.First Lines:
…That day a man devoutly heryth masseWhyle he ys present he
                    schall not wexen olde…
CamGon174.Last Lines:
…Wyth godely support to do correctionThe to reforme where as
                    they se nede
CamGon174.Note:
lines 593-664 only due to missing quires preceding p. 451; but includes
                    one-stanza envoy; in 8-line stanzas, ababbcbc.

CamTCC601.First Lines:
yE folkys all whyche haue deuocioun To here musse furst do your
                    besy cure With all your inward contemplacion As in a myrrour
                    presentyng in figure…
CamTCC601.Last Lines:
…With goodly support to do correccion Thee to reforme where as
                    they se nede
CamTCC601.Attributed Author:
Lydgate (added by later hand, f. 205v); John Lydgate (added by
                    later hand after explicit , f. 214, and at sub-headings throughout, ff.
                        206v, 207v, etc.)
CamTCC601.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. I: Religious Poems.
EETS
         e.s. 107 (1911; repr. 1961): 86-115.

BLAdd31042.First Lines: …Iudica me deus with hole hert and EntereTheire constyence purge fro …e synnes seuene…
BLAdd31042.Last Lines: …Withe goostely supporte to doo correccyoneThe reforme where as þay see nede
BLAdd31042.Note: Missing lines 1-57. Begins imperfectly at top of leaf; includes envoy, one stanza; ends “Amen.”

BLAru396.First Lines:
The folkes alle whiche haue deuocyonTo heere masse first dooth
                    youre besy cure…
BLAru396.Last Lines:
…With goostly supporte to doon correctyonThe to refoorme as
                    thei seen neede. Amen

BLHar2251.First Lines:
YE that beth of goode deuocyounTo here youre masse with al your
                    cure…
BLHar2251.Last Lines:
…With goodely support to do correcciounThe to reforme where
                    they se nede

Lam344.First Lines:
…Kyrye and christe þu nombre thryes threWords of greke
                    playnly to determyne…
Lam344.Last Lines:
…Wyth goodly support to do correxcyounThe to reforme where as
                    they se nede
Lam344.Note:
Begins imprefectly due to loss of leaf: missing stanzas
                    1-23.
Lam344.Attributed Author:
John Lidgate . how to hear Mass (wants þe Begining) — in a much
                    later hand (flyleaf, verso)
